00038 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00039 //  CLASS : sc_event_finder

00041 //  Event finder base class.
00042 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00043 
00044 class SC_API sc_event_finder
00045 {
00046   friend class sc_simcontext;
00047 
00048 public:
00049     // helper to create an event finder on demand and cache in given pointer
00050     //  - if cache_p is NULL, allocate a new sc_event_finder_t<IF>
00051     //    for the given function, save allocated pointer in cache_p
00052     //  - returns dereferenced cache_p pointer
00053     template<typename IF>
00054     static sc_event_finder&
00055     cached_create( sc_event_finder*& cache_p, const sc_port_base& port_
00056                  , const sc_event& (IF::*ef_p)() const );
00057 
00058     const sc_port_base& port() const
00059         { return m_port; }
00060 
00061     // destructor (does nothing)
00062     virtual ~sc_event_finder();
00063 
00064     virtual const sc_event& find_event( sc_interface* if_p = 0 ) const = 0;
00065 
00066 protected:
00067 
00068     // constructor
00069     sc_event_finder( const sc_port_base& );
00070 
00071     // error reporting
00072     void report_error( const char* id, const char* add_msg = 0 ) const;
00073 
00074 
00075 private:
00076     const  sc_port_base&    m_port;    // port providing the event.
00077 
00078 private:
00079 
00080     // disabled
00081     sc_event_finder();
00082     sc_event_finder( const sc_event_finder& );
00083     sc_event_finder& operator = ( const sc_event_finder& );
00084 };

00104         {}
00105 
00106     // destructor (does nothing)
00107

00110

00112

00128 
00129 template <class IF>
00130 inline
00131 sc_event_finder&
00132 sc_event_finder::cached_create( sc_event_finder*& cache_p
00133                               , const sc_port_base& port_
00134                               , const sc_event& (IF::*ef_p)() const )
00135 {
00136     if( !cache_p ) {
00137         cache_p = new sc_event_finder_t<IF>( port_, ef_p );
00138     }
00139     sc_assert( &port_ == &cache_p->port() );
00140     return *cache_p;
00141 }
00142 
00143 
00144 template <class IF>
00145 inline
00146 const sc_event&
00147 sc_event_finder_t<IF>::find_event( sc_interface* if_p ) const
00148 {
00149     const IF* iface = ( if_p ) ? dynamic_cast<const IF*>( if_p ) :
00150                                  dynamic_cast<const IF*>( port().get_interface() );
00151     if( iface == 0 ) {
00152         report_error( SC_ID_FIND_EVENT_, "port is not bound" );
00153         return sc_event::none;
00154     }
00155     return (const_cast<IF*>( iface )->*m_event_method) ();
00156 }

00172 // Andy Goodrich: implemented a much better fix to the sc_event_finder
00173 // proliferation problem. This new version allocates only a single event
00174 // finder for each port for each type of event, e.g., pos(), neg(), and
00175 // value_change(). The event finder persists as long as the port does,
00176 // which is what the LRM dictates. Because only a single instance is
00177 // allocated for each event type per port there is not a potential
00178 // explosion of storage as was true in the 2.0.1/2.1 versions.
